result.execSummary:
The defendant Lisa Jean Soulier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Report to County Jail (10 Days +), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.425(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Granted good time and Huber release under the terms of the Sheriff.
The Def is to contact Ashland Co Jail to make arrangements to provide a DNA specimen w/in 7 days.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lisa Jean Soulier

records.addlTxt: 10:38 AM Defendant Lisa Jean Soulier appeared by video from conference room at the court house.  Attorney Ralph David Imholte appeared by video for Lisa Jean Soulier.  Attorney David Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.   File contains Offer to Settle and PLQ.  Parties have an agreement.  Def waives right to personal appearance.  Atty is satisfied.  Court is satisfied and accepts waiver.  Atty, def pleads GUILTY, def agrees.  Def understands information, rights giving up, and elements.  Atty is satisfied.  Court is satisfied and accepts GUILTY plea.  As a factual basis can court rely on the information in the complain, parties agree.  Court finds a factual basis exists and finds def GUILTY, directs judgment to enter.  State comments on sentencing.  Immediate remand to be taken into custody.  Atty comments on sentencing.  Def makes a statement.  Credit at zero.  If Officer Grubisic cannot transport needs to be at jail no later than 11:30.
of Rt to Personal Appearance

records.addlTxt: Initial appearance on June 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.

09:38 AM Defendant Lisa Jean Soulier in court via Zoom video from Oneida Co Jail.  Lynne K Van Hollen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  COVID - ZOOM; all parties agree to appear via ZOOM today. Warrant cancelled. Not employed. Case pending in MN. Not on Probation. Has family in Ashland County. State commenting -- $750.00 cash bail. Atty Brewer making a special appr -- ties to Ashland County. Court orders: $750.00 cash bail. If Def at liberty, must appear in-person.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
